snippet: Notwithstanding their name, African wild dogs are “true altruists,” researchers say, essentially willing to sacrifice their lives for the pack, and are slowly coming back from near extinction.
abstract: African wild dogs, once thought to be in danger of extinction, are proving far more resilient than many experts had expected; researchers have long noted dogs' social and civic-minded behavior, but continue to be surprised by depths of their self-sacrificing actions; dog populations are inching up across Africa, but they are still considered endangered.
lead_paragraph: Notwithstanding their name, African wild dogs are “true altruists,” researchers say, essentially willing to sacrifice their lives for the pack, and are slowly coming back from near extinction.

headline.print_headline: One for All, and All for Hunt
headline.seo: African Wild Dogs, True Best Friends
headline.main: One for All, and All for Hunt
